title: Obscure 80s Post-Punk, Experimental, Art Rock Vol. 2
description:
What you'll find in these series is an interesting collection of very obscure art rock/indie rock/post punk/new wave songs, released in early 80s on private, no-name, private labels. The releases were mostly singles and EPs or part of a various artists underground compilation. The bands are referred to as DIY, or do-it-yourself. Although the songs are generally quite interesting they were too arty and experimental for pop-dominated Rare Hits of The 80s series, so I skipped them while making those series. Then since they are not synth-dominated, quirky and danceable tracks, they could not it into This Is What I call Minimal 80s series either. However this style of music definitely has its own audience and deserves some recognition. More likely than not, some of these tracks are on some people's wish list. So here you are and part 2. Enjoy and seed.


Tracklisting:

01 Home Service - Wake-up!
02 Michael's Toy - Cry Now It's Over
03 Last Four (4) Digits - Another Sex Crime
04 The Mothmen - Does It Matter Irene
05 The Vincent Units - Carnival Song
06 Observers Observing Observables - Watch Out For The Other Guy
07 Someone and The Somebodies - Newvo
08 The Colors Out Of Time - Dancing With Joy
09 Three Times A Day - Storm
10 Treatment Room - Awayday
11 Those Hellicopters - Southcoast Towns
12 Cry Shark - One Phone Call
13 Disturbed Furniture - Information
14 People In Stores - Metaphor
15 Science Patrol - Bandit Ducks From Outer Space
16 Limbo Race - Small Talking
